title: Store XSS on Informatica University via transcript (informatica.csod.com)

profile.name: Informatica
profile.about: Informatica Corporation is the worldâ€™s number one independent provider of data integration software.

vulnerability_information: Hi, Vulnerable field: Training Description Steps to reproduce: 1. Login to your account and go Informatica University. 2. You can either click on "My Training" or "Universal Profile" at the upper right hand corner of the page. 3. You will then be redirected to the Universal profile bio page, click on the "Transcript tab" 4. Select options on the upper right side then select "Add external training: on the drop down option. 5. Fill out the needed information but for the Training Description use the following payload: '"> 6. Complete the rest of the form and click on Submit. 7. You will then be redirected to your training transcript. 8. On the right side of the transcript which has a label withdraw, select from the drop down "View training details" 9. The page will be redirected and you will then get the xss pop-up. Would be best to sanitize all input on this form to avoid xss. Works on latest versions of chrome, and firefox. Please let me know if you need further information. Thanks! Cheers, @ninjakatz__
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi,

Vulnerable field: Training Description

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Login to your account and go Informatica University.
  2. You can either click on "My Training" or "Universal Profile" at the upper right hand corner of the page.
  3. You will then be redirected to the Universal profile bio page, click on the "Transcript tab"
  4. Select options on the upper right side then select "Add external training: on the drop down option.
  5. Fill out the needed information but for the Training Description use the following payload: '"><img src=x onerror=alert(document.cookie);>
  6. Complete the rest of the form and click on Submit.
  7. You will then be redirected to your training transcript.
  8. On the right side of the transcript which has a label withdraw, select from the drop down "View training details"
  9. The page will be redirected and you will then get the xss pop-up.

Would be best to sanitize all input on this form to avoid xss.

Works on latest versions of chrome, and firefox.

Please let me know if you need further information. Thanks!

Cheers,

@ninjakatz__

additional_data.new_title: Store XSS on Informatica University via transcript (informatica.csod.com)

activities.message:
Hello @tarantula_hawk,

Apologies for bugging you and thanks for checking into this. Attached is a video poc for the said bug on this endpoint. All other parameters on the site are already being sanitized except for the "training description" field which still has html and xss injection.

VIdeo: F177408

Please do let me know if you need further information. Thanks!

PS: Is it possible to set the report into traiged so I can know which of my reports are already checked as well. Would appreciate that. Have a great day!

Cheers,

@ninjakatz__

activities.message:
Hi @tarantula_hawk,

The xss can be executed using the latest version of chrome and firefox. 

Normally external training requires **"Separate approval is required to mark the item complete."** which indicates that an admin or course moderator needs to validate these external training before they are approved. That would be a perfect scenario wherein the script can be executed on the admin/moderator end to steal cookies.

By fixing this endpoint, this can also help strengthen security since there is a possibility that courses in the future can be shared either via trainee-to-trainee or trainee-to-admin environment. 

Hope this can help verify on your end as well.

Cheers,

@ninjakatz__
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @tarantula_hawk,

The xss can be executed using the latest version of chrome and firefox.

Normally external training requires "Separate approval is required to mark the item complete." which indicates that an admin or course moderator needs to validate these external training before they are approved. That would be a perfect scenario wherein the script can be executed on the admin/moderator end to steal cookies.

By fixing this endpoint, this can also help strengthen security since there is a possibility that courses in the future can be shared either via trainee-to-trainee or trainee-to-admin environment.

Hope this can help verify on your end as well.

Cheers,

@ninjakatz__

activities.message:
Hi @tarantula_hawk,

Just checked and can confirm that "new accounts" doesn't have the option to add a transcript which helps avoid abuse on the endpoint. Nice Temp patch.

Will this report be tagged as "resolved" now?

Was also wondering since there were changes made and possibly another patch applied in the future, will this be eligible for a bounty or swag? Would really appreciate it.

Again, it was nice working with you and hope to find more bugs in this platform soon as a I have time to hunt.

Cheers,

@ninjakatz__
